title: A trade for the No. 1 pick?! Let's project next year's first round in Yates' updated NFL mock draft
content: Which teams need a quarterback? Could Ohio State dominate the first round? Field Yates projects the opening 32 picks of next year's draft.

title: Sirianni on possibly benching Hurts: 'Ridiculous'
content: Eagles coach Nick Sirianni said quarterback Jalen Hurts is "absolutely" his starter for Sunday's game against the Raiders and called it "ridiculous" when asked about the possibility of making a change at some point this season.

title: Big 12 commish: Irish AD's behavior 'egregious'
content: Big 12 commissioner Brett Yormark took issue Tuesday with Notre Dame athletic director Pete Bevacqua's criticism this week of the ACC, calling his behavior "egregious."

title: WNBA star Wilson earns AP Female Athlete of Year
content: A'ja Wilson stood atop the WNBA again, winning an unprecedented fourth MVP as her Las Vegas Aces earned a third championship in four seasons. For that, she earned The Associated Press Female Athlete of the Year for the first time.

title: Sources: Tigers give Finnegan 2-year, $19M pact
content: Kyle Finnegan, 34, and the Tigers are in agreement on a two-year, $19 million contract, sources told ESPN's Jeff Passan on Tuesday, confirming a report. Detroit keeps a key bullpen piece as it seeks a third straight playoff appearance.

title: White Sox win draft lottery, will pick 1st in 2026
content: The White Sox, who had the best odds to win the 2026 MLB draft lottery, will pick first in next summer's draft, followed by the Rays at No. 2 and the Twins at No. 3.

title: Slot wonders if Salah thinks he 'made a mistake'
content: Liverpool coach Arne Slot questioned whether Mohamed Salah should be the one to initiate a conversation with him following his explosive interview at the weekend.

title: Paul 'at peace with everything' after Clips ouster
content: Chris Paul said he's "at peace with everything" and is excited for what's next following his stunning ouster from the LA Clippers earlier this month.

title: Knicks, closer to an identity, reach NBA Cup semis
content: The Knicks advanced to the NBA Cup semifinals in Las Vegas with a convincing 117-101 victory over the Raptors on Tuesday night, their eighth victory in nine games.

title: üèà How Colts signed Philip Rivers out of retirement
content: Philip Rivers hasn't taken a snap since 2020, but he might be about to enter a playoff race against elite defenses.

title: Chris Paul's 'get-better mentality' paved the way for OKC's dominance
content: Paul spent only one season in OKC but left a lasting impression on reigning MVP Shai Gilgeous-Alexander.

title: NFL Week 15 buzz: What we're hearing about Daniel Jones, the upcoming coaching carousel and more
content: What effect will Jones' injury have on the offseason QB market? How many coaching jobs could be open? Here's the latest NFL intel heading into Week 15.

title: Predicting the top 5 picks in the 2026 MLB draft after White Sox win lottery
content: With Chicago landing the No. 1 overall pick for next summer, let's see how the start of the first round could go down.

title: Final Olympic hockey roster predictions for U.S., Canada, more: Which NHL stars make it?
content: The NHL is back at the Games. Here's our final look at which players will make the cut for the big five.

title: The hope and heroism of Army safety Larry Pickett Jr.
content: In August, Pickett Jr. and his family came upon a terrifying scene: power lines down, a car on fire and a man close to death.

title: MLB winter meetings updates, rumors: Will there be a blockbuster move on the final day?
content: Here's everything you need from Orlando as trade speculation and free agency buzz continues to swirl.

title: Women's Power Rankings: Unbeaten Hawkeyes, Cyclones enter top 10 ahead of Jimmy V matchup
content: The total number of Cy-Hawk meetings is in dispute. What is not: Both teams are unbeaten, and in the top-10.

title: 5 early lessons of men's basketball season: Real vs. pretend contenders, more
content: Michigan is better than expected. Kentucky is worse. And Duke headlines an ACC that looks as if it's "back."

title: Jimmy V Men's Classic guide: Breaking down BYU, UConn wins
content: BYU and UConn pulled off close victories against Clemson and Florida in the 2025 Jimmy V Men's Classic.

title: NBA Power Rankings: What is each team's biggest weakness?
content: NBA insiders break down the latest Power Rankings, evaluating all 30 teams as the Emirates NBA Cup heats up.

title: How Derik Queen became the Pelicans' future after a shocking draft-night trade
content: Queen, the face of a controversial trade, is tasked with rescuing a franchise that is experiencing another difficult campaign

title: Everything Shams is hearing on NBA trade season: Where could Anthony Davis land?
content: As trade season nears, the futures of Davis and Giannis Antetokounmpo are in focus. Here's all we're hearing.

title: If Liverpool replace Salah, they have to go big and sign one of these guys
content: Liverpool winger Mohamed Salah could be on the way out in January, and the Reds have to think big if they want to replace his goals and assist numbers.

title: How each of the 12 College Football Playoff teams could win the national title
content: Bill Connelly breaks down the path to victory for every team -- and what will hold each of them back.

title: Ten (maybe 11) players to watch at NCAA volleyball tournament's Sweet 16
content: The NCAA volleyball tournament is down to its final 16 teams, and Olivia Babcock, Rebekah Allick and Logan Lednicky are among the players who will help determine who makes the cut to the final four.

title: VAR Review: Why was Konate's goal ruled out and why did it take so long?
content: Liverpool had a goal disallowed for handball vs. Inter Milan but the review took ages. What happened?

title: Wolfsburg's wastefulness opens door for Madrid to join UWCL contenders
content: Former powerhouse Wolfsburg's campaign is unraveling, while Real Madrid look poised to finish top-four in the UWCL table.

title: Consider the facts about these seven players and feel bold setting a playoff lineup
content: Liz Loza provides facts on players about whom you may have mixed feelings in win-or-go-home playoff matchups.

title: Men's Bracketology: Iowa State replaces Purdue as a 1-seed
content: In knocking off former 1-seed Purdue, unbeaten Iowa State changed its trajectory and is now on the top line.

title: 2025 boxing top 100: Crawford, Inoue, Usyk lead rankings
content: Andreas Hale picks the top 100 fighters in men's boxing, including champions, top contenders and a lot of new faces.

title: Week 14 only added more chaos to the NFL playoff race -- "a bookmaker's dream"
content: Week 14 "set the tone" for many NFL teams as Super Bowl favorites faltered and underdogs picked up steam.

title: Early Week 15 bets: Patriots over Bills, Lions to cover in shootout with Rams
content: What lines offered value once odds came out? Here are five games we're eyeing for bets going into Week 15.

title: 'First Nehru, then Indira, then Sonia': Shah accuses Cong of 'vote chori'; triggers protest
content: Home minister Amit Shah accused the Congress of "vote chori" in Lok Sabha, citing alleged instances involving Jawaharlal Nehru, Indira Gandhi, and a pending case against Sonia Gandhi regarding voter registration. Congress MPs protested, with KC Venugopal asserting the case against Sonia Gandhi was dismissed. Shah maintained he stated a fact about a court case.

title: Watch: Rahul interrupts Shah with 'open challenge'; gets 'I will decide' reply
content: Lok Sabha witnessed a heated exchange as Rahul Gandhi challenged Home Minister Amit Shah to a debate on the Special Investigation Report and alleged fake voters. Shah firmly stated he would decide the debate's timing and sequence, asserting parliamentary procedure. He countered 'vote chori' claims, referencing past instances and a Delhi High Court case involving Sonia Gandhi.

title: Ally or adversary? Why 2026 B'desh polls are critical for India - explained
content: Bangladesh's February 2026 election is pivotal for India's regional security following Sheikh Hasina's ouster. The ban on the Awami League creates a vacuum, potentially empowering parties critical of India. This shift demands a rapid re-evaluation of New Delhi's policy towards its crucial eastern neighbour, impacting connectivity, trade, and counter-insurgency efforts.

title: PM Modi receives call from Netanyahu; reaffirms support for Gaza peace plan
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Israeli PM Benjamin Netanyahu held a telephonic conversation, emphasizing the robust India-Israel strategic partnership. Both leaders unequivocally condemned terrorism and pledged to bolster bilateral relations. They also exchanged views on the West Asia situation, with PM Modi reiterating India's support for a just and lasting peace, including the Gaza Peace Plan.

title: Mixed signals? US trade aide says India tough 'nut to crack'; hails 'best-ever offers'
content: India is a tough nut but offers 'best' proposals in trade talks with the US, according to USTR Jamieson Greer. Discussions are underway for a bilateral trade agreement, aiming to resolve tariff issues and boost trade to $500 billion by 2030. Both nations are negotiating a framework deal and a comprehensive agreement.

title: Jamie Dimon poaches Buffett's investor: Jeff Bezos, Dell join; $1.5T at stake
content: JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon has formed a high-profile advisory council, including tech titans and defense leaders, to guide a massive $1.5 trillion national security spending plan. The initiative aims to bolster American self-reliance by investing in critical technologies and reducing dependence on foreign suppliers, particularly China.  A new $10 billion fund will back companies in advanced chips and AI.

title: House-to-house, form-to-form: The unseen daily grind of BLOs amid SIR rollout
content: Booth Level Officers (BLOs) in West Bengal are facing immense pressure and exhaustion during the Special Intensive Revision of electoral rolls. Working 12-16 hour days, they are struggling with tight deadlines, demanding tasks, and fear of consequences, blurring the lines between work and personal life. Political parties blame each other for the strain.

title: One spot, two match-winners: Arsh or Kul ‚Äî Why India can fit only one Deep in T20Is
content: India's T20I selection against South Africa highlights Jitesh Sharma's preference over Sanju Samson for wicketkeeping, signaling a focus on lower-order batting. The team also appears to favor only one specialist between Arshdeep Singh and Kuldeep Yadav, prioritizing batting depth. In spin-friendly conditions in the UAE during the Asia Cup, Arshdeep was left out for most matches.

title: H1b visas: US Embassy's advisory to applicants - 'Will not be allowed inside if'
content: US Embassy India has issued a crucial advisory for visa applicants, warning that attending a previously scheduled appointment after receiving a rescheduling notice will lead to denied entry. This comes as H-1B visa interviews are being postponed due to new social media vetting rules, potentially delaying foreign workers' return to the US for months.

title: 'I don't think I love ...': Mandhana breaks silence; makes public appearance after wedding cancelled
content: India's star batter Smriti Mandhana revealed her deep passion for cricket, stating nothing matters more than the sport and wearing the national jersey. Reflecting on the World Cup win, she described it as the culmination of years of hard work and disappointment, a victory for all who paved the way.

title: SIR storm: Shah defuses Rahul's 'bomb' on 'vote chori'; gives detailed rebuttal
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah has refuted Rahul Gandhi's allegations of vote theft in Haryana. Shah clarified that a house listed with a single number housed multiple families and that duplicate voter entries are a result of systemic issues, not manipulation by the BJP or Election Commission.

title: End of road for Samson? Why Gill's return in T20Is tilts debate in Jitesh' favour
content: Jitesh Sharma's emergence as the preferred wicketkeeper-batter for the T20 World Cup signals a strategic shift, prioritizing finishing ability over top-order roles. This selection, alongside the dilemma of fitting both Arshdeep Singh and Kuldeep Yadav, highlights key tactical decisions as India aims for stability ahead of the tournament.

title: Ex-BlackBerry CEO's ‚Äòurgent message': Urges Canada PM for action on US policy
content: Former BlackBerry CEO Jim Balsillie urges Canada to act decisively following the US National Security Strategy. He warns against economic subordination, advocating for Canadian data sovereignty and prioritizing domestic tech firms. Balsillie stresses the need for "reorientation and capacity" to build resilience against US dominance, calling for a significant shift in policy to protect national interests.

title: Goa fire: Nightclub co-owner hid in Delhi hospital to stall arrest; how police smoked him out
content: Goa nightclub co-owner Ajay Gupta was apprehended in a Delhi hospital after allegedly feigning spine issues to evade arrest in the deadly blaze. He was detained by Delhi Police's Crime Branch and will be handed over to Goa Police for further questioning regarding the nightclub's management and fire-safety lapses.

title: IPL 2026: Auction Preview- KKR eye a big rebuild with the largest purse
content: Defending champions Kolkata Knight Riders, surprisingly finishing eighth in 2025 after their 2024 triumph, face a crucial auction on December 16. With a trimmed squad and a significant purse, they aim to address top-order issues, secure a wicketkeeper, and crucially, land a powerful overseas all-rounder like Cameron Green to rebuild for a resurgence.

title: India‚Äôs student suicide crisis: A nation watching marks, missing minds
content: India‚Äôs student-suicide crisis is no longer a series of isolated tragedies but a structural failure unfolding across classrooms and homes. NCRB data shows a steep decade-long rise, while recent cases expose how humiliation, bullying, fractured communication and stigma go unnoticed. Experts, principals and parents argue that prevention demands emotionally safe schools, responsive families and systems that learn to listen early.

title: US visa chaos: Now a tweet can tank your American dream; screening gets intrusive
content: US Customs and Border Protection is proposing to require nearly all foreign visitors to disclose up to five years of social media activity, along with phone numbers and email addresses. This expanded screening, potentially affecting millions of travelers, aims to enhance border security but raises significant privacy and free expression concerns. The rule could be finalized by mid-2026.

title: Next CIC: Rahul raises dissent; holds 2-hr meet with PM Modi, Shah
content: Rahul Gandhi met PM Modi and Amit Shah to finalise key appointments for the Central Information Commission and Central Vigilance Commission, submitting a dissent note. This meeting occurred as Gandhi's upcoming Berlin visit for an Indian Overseas Congress event drew criticism from the BJP, accusing him of prioritizing foreign trips over parliamentary duties.

title: 'Went to Thailand for work': Goa nightclub owners seek transit anticipatory bail
content: Luthra brothers, owners of Birch by Romeo Lane, seek transit anticipatory bail in Delhi, claiming they traveled to Thailand for work and intend to cooperate with the investigation. Meanwhile, their beach shack in Goa is slated for demolition following a devastating fire that killed 25 people at their nightclub.

title: Silent Hill 1 Remake: Release date, platforms, gameplay, and key details
content: Konami's Silent Hill franchise revival continues with the highly-anticipated Silent Hill 1 remake, now in full production by Bloober Team. This modern update to the 1999 survival horror classic is rumored to feature expanded exploration and modernized gameplay. Fans anticipate a Summer 2027 release on PC and PlayStation 5, with potential showcases at The Game Awards 2025.

title: Mandhana seen in public for the first time after calling off wedding; social media erupts - Watch
content: Indian cricketer Smriti Mandhana has publicly reappeared following the cancellation of her wedding to Palash Muchhal.  Despite a difficult period, she's been seen resuming training, signaling a return to her focus on cricket.  Mandhana confirmed the wedding's halt, requesting privacy for both families as she dedicates herself to representing India.

title: IndiGo crisis: DGCA deploys oversight team at airline's HQ; flight ops under lens
content: In response to recent flight disruptions that have left many passengers stranded, the Civil Aviation Ministry has established a specialized oversight team to oversee IndiGo's operations. This proactive step aims to mitigate the inconvenience caused by extensive delays and cancellations.

title: Consequences companies could face under Right to Disconnect Bill
content: The Right to Disconnect Bill outlines clear consequences for companies that continue to demand after-hours availability, proposing financial penalties, mandatory transparency, and enforceable communication norms. While not yet enacted, the proposal signals a decisive shift in how India expects employers to respect personal time. If adopted, it could redefine accountability in an era where digital overreach has become routine.

title: Sandeshkhali case: Witness against TMC leader hurt in accident; was enroute to court
content: A key witness in the Sandeshkhali attack case, Bholanath Ghosh, was critically injured in a road accident where his car was hit by a truck. His son and driver died in the incident. Ghosh's family alleges a conspiracy by TMC leader Shahjahan Sheikh, currently in jail, to silence him. The accident occurred while Ghosh was en route to court.

title: 'They can do a 10-part TV series': How teams prepare for IPL auctions? Team mentor reveals
content: Dinesh Karthik shared insights into the demanding IPL mini-auction build-up. He described the extensive planning and discussions involved. Karthik found the process challenging yet highly enjoyable. He highlighted the strategic depth and competitive nature of auction decisions. The Royal Challengers Bengaluru mentor emphasized the intricate work behind team selection.

title: PIO nurse sentenced to jail in UK for raping and assaulting colleagues in care home
content: An Indian-origin nurse, Naijil Paul, has been sentenced to over seven years in jail in Scotland for raping a colleague and sexually assaulting two others. Paul fled to India before his 2019 trial but was extradited after six years. He pleaded guilty to the charges, which occurred in 2018 while he managed Acorn Park Care Home in Glasgow.

title: Democrats compare Kelce to Trump after Texas loss despite Swift support
content: The Democrats' social media account posted a video comparing NFL player Travis Kelce to Donald Trump. This move drew criticism from fans, especially since Kelce's fianc√©e, Taylor Swift, is a prominent supporter of the Democrats. The video showed Kelce in a game and Trump golfing. Fans expressed confusion and dismay over the comparison, particularly given the Chiefs' playoff struggles.

title: 'My hero': Mahieka Sharma shares emotional posts; declares Hardik Pandya the 'king'
content: Hardik Pandya marked a powerful return from injury, leading India to a dominant win against South Africa and earning Player of the Match. He credited his comeback to self-belief and the unwavering support of loved ones, especially his girlfriend Mahieka Sharma. Pandya expressed his commitment to enjoying the game and striving for continuous improvement.

title: Jayden Daniels injury update: Will Commanders QB return in Week 15?
content: Washington Commanders' quarterback Jayden Daniels suffered a setback in his return from an elbow injury, exiting Week 14's game after re-aggravating the issue. Despite the concern, head coach Dan Quinn indicated Daniels won't be shut down, with his Week 15 status against the Giants pending medical clearance. The team prioritizes his development over immediate playoff hopes.

title: 'Not gonna lie': Naomi Osaka rejects proposal, opens up on tough days as mom
content: Naomi Osaka opened up about motherhood's challenges and rejected a fan's marriage proposal during an Instagram Q&A. Despite an injury-shortened 2025 season ending at the Japan Open, she expressed pride in her resilience and gratitude for her health and daughter, Shai. Osaka is slated to begin her 2026 season at the ASB Classic.

title: Gujarat teen chops friend into pieces over affairs
content: Jealousy over a shared love interest led to a brutal murder in Kutch. A 19-year-old allegedly killed his friend, dismembered the body, and buried the parts across the district. The crime surfaced after the victim's brother filed a missing person report, triggering an investigation that revealed a complex love triangle and a desperate attempt to conceal the horrific act.

title: HECI bill faces heat as CPI(M) MP warns of opaque drafting and threat to autonomy
content: A contentious battle is unfolding over the Centre‚Äôs move to introduce the Higher Education Commission of India Bill, with CPI(M) MP John Brittas urging ministers to halt the plan until the draft is made public and stakeholders are consulted. He warns that rushing the overhaul risks undermining autonomy, federal principles and the governance structure of India‚Äôs higher-education system.

title: Starlink price plans for India: Musk-led firm may charge Rs 2,500-3,500 per month; check details
content: Elon Musk's Starlink is set to launch satellite internet in India, with prices expected between Rs 2,500-3,500 monthly for consumers. The company has secured necessary licenses for various sectors, though official pricing awaits regulatory approvals and spectrum allocation.

title: ICC Rankings: Virat Kohli vs Rohit Sharma - Battle for No.1 ODI batter heats up
content: Star India batter Virat Kohli is closing in on the No.1 ODI batter ranking, now second behind Rohit Sharma after a stellar series against South Africa.  Other Indian cricketers like KL Rahul and Kuldeep Yadav also saw significant climbs in the ICC rankings across formats, highlighting India's strong presence in international cricket.

title: Andrew Tate gives opinion on Jake Paul vs Anthony Joshua ahead of Dubai debut
content: Andrew Tate shared his thoughts on the upcoming Jake Paul vs. Anthony Joshua fight, calling it "interesting" just days before his own boxing debut. Tate expressed respect for anyone entering the ring and hoped both Paul and Joshua would emerge safely. He also addressed weight clause controversies surrounding his own fight, stating he accepted all conditions.

title: Two apples, one handwash: Pakistan's strangest theft case from judge's chamber
content: Police in Pakistan's Punjab province have registered a theft case over two apples and a hand wash bottle stolen from a sessions court judge's chamber in Lahore. The FIR was filed based on the judge's instructions, with the stolen items valued at Rs 1,000. The case is being investigated under Section 380 of the Pakistan Penal Code.

title: 'Don't want your mercy': Mamata Banerjee tears up MGNREGA note - watch
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee publicly tore up new MGNREGA norms, accusing the Centre of imposing 'valueless' conditions and withholding funds. She highlighted her state's Karmashree scheme as an alternative, vowing to increase workdays and asserting Bengal's fight for dignity and federal rights amidst upcoming elections.

title: Veggie 'burgers' under fire: Why is Europe planning to ban names of plant-based foods?
content: EU countries and lawmakers are set for contentious negotiations over a proposal to ban plant-based foods from using traditional meat labels like "sausage" and "burger." Backed by the European Parliament to protect farmers, the measure aims to reserve meat terminology for animal products, sparking debate over consumer transparency and the plant-based sector's future.

title: Nasa astronaut Jonny Kim returns from ISS after 8 months
content: NASA astronaut Jonny Kim has returned to Earth after an eight-month mission aboard the International Space Station. He conducted vital research in areas like bioprinting and robotics, contributing to advancements in medicine and future space exploration. The mission highlights the ISS's crucial role in scientific discovery and preparing for deeper space travel.

title: ‚ÄòVande Mataram or Goa tragedy‚Äîwhat‚Äôs more emotional?‚Äô Akhilesh blames BJP as Luthra brothers flee
content: A tragic fire in Goa claimed 25 lives. Samajwadi Party MP Akhilesh Yadav criticized government regulations. He stated the accused owners fled to Thailand. Authorities are investigating the expired licenses and the local body's failure to act. Efforts are underway to apprehend the fugitives.

title: Chinese woman uses her scarf to clean up spilled bubble tea in metro ‚Äî watch
content: A thoughtful woman in China has earned widespread praise after using her own scarf to clean up spilled bubble tea on a subway. The heartwarming incident, captured on video, quickly went viral, highlighting her respect for public spaces.  In recognition of her considerate act, the subway company reportedly gifted her a new scarf and other presents.

title: 'How can tickets cost Rs 35-39k?' HC pulls up govt over IndiGo chaos
content: The Delhi high court questioned the Centre's failure to prevent IndiGo's flight cancellations and soaring airfares, demanding to know immediate measures taken for stranded passengers. The court also sought explanations on arrangements made to manage travellers and prevent harassment, as hundreds of flights were scrapped, leaving lakhs stranded nationwide.

title: Israeli PM Netanyahu Calls PM Modi, Briefs On West Asia Situation
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Wednesday spoke with his Israeli counterpart Benjamin Netanyahu and discussed ways to further strengthen the strategic partnership between the two nations.

title: Parliament Session Highlights: Amit Shah Addresses Lok Sabha On Poll Reforms Debate
content: Parliament Winter Session Highlights: Lok Sabha will discuss Election Reforms, while the Rajya Sabha will witness the conclusion of 'Vande Mataram' debate.

title: "Mahayuti To Fight 2029 Polls Together:" Devendra Fadnavis To NDTV Amid Talk Of Rift
content: Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis reaffirmed that the ruling Mahayuti alliance will contest the 2029 Maharashtra Assembly elections together, while both BJP and the Shinde-led Shiv Sena work to strengthen their individual bases.

title: US Plans Mandatory Social Media Disclosure For Visa-Exempt Tourists
content: The administration of US President Donald Trump plans to order visa-exempt foreign tourists to disclose their social media histories from the last five years before entering the country, according to an official notice.

title: Video: Mamata Banerjee Tears Centre's Note, Says Funds Being Used As Weapon
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Tuesday tore up a note outlining new MGNREGA norms at a public meeting here, calling it a "valueless and insulting" diktat.

title: Refused Cigarettes On Credit, Group Thrashes Shopkeeper With Sticks
content: A petty argument over refusing to give cigarettes on credit turned into shocking street violence, turning the main road outside Gwalior district's Gadrauli village into a crime scene.

title: "I Was Able To Do What No One Could": Devendra Fadnavis On Thackeray Reunion
content: Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis jocularly took credit for the reunion of Thackeray cousins Uddhav and Raj Thackeray, saying, "I was able to do what no one could".

title: After Privacy Lapses, Delhi Mandates Separate Areas For Women In Night Shelters
content: As Delhi reels under its coldest December spell in years, with night temperatures crashing below 5 degrees Celsius and a brutal cold wave gripping the capital, over 46,000 homeless people fight for survival on its streets

title: Luthra Brothers Booked Thailand Tickets While Their Nightclub Was On Fire
content: The probe into the nightclub inferno in Goa has uncovered new evidence indicating that the owners, brothers Saurabh and Gaurav Luthra, booked flight tickets to Thailand at the very moment emergency services were trying to control the blaze.

title: 13 Accounts, With Rs 55 Crore, Of Reliance Infra Seized In Laundering Case
content: In a major action against suspected foreign exchange violations, the Directorate of Enforcement (ED), Special Task Force at its Headquarters, has seized assets worth Rs 54.82 crore belonging to Reliance Infrastructure Limited (R-Infra).

title: Hours Before Hearing, Key Sandeshkhali Witness Injured In Crash, Son Killed
content: A key witness in cases linked to the Sandeshkhali controversy in West Bengal has been seriously injured in a road accident, in which his younger son and the driver of his car were killed.

title: Indians Getting Poor Quality Protein, Nearly 50% Is From Cereals: Study
content: Nearly half of India's at-home protein intake now comes from cereals such as rice, wheat, suji, and maida, according to a study on Wednesday.

title: Congress Opposing EVMs Rajiv Gandhi Introduced: Amit Shah's Counterattack
content: Electronic Voting machines were introduced in the country by former Prime Minister Rajiv Gandhi and it is his son and his party now that oppose them, Union Home Minister Amit Shah said today in a blistering counter to Opposition allegations on EVMs.

title: 'Nehru, Indira Did Vote Chori': Amit Shah vs Rahul Gandhi Escalates In Parliament
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah's speech in the Lok Sabha during the debate on electoral reforms saw a fiery face-off between him and Leader of the Opposition Rahul Gandhi.

title: 'Lies Spread About SIR, Efforts Being Made To Mislead People': Amit Shah
content: Union Minister Amit Shah said today that he feels the Special Intensive Revision of voter list should not be discussed in parliament but the government is going along with the Opposition demand to show they are not running away.

title: Watch: Leopard, Tranquilized, Struggles To Climb Roof After Injuring 7 In Nagpur
content: Seven people were injured after a leopard entered a densely populated area in Maharashtra's Nagpur city on Wednesday morning and attacked the residents.

title: Amid Rising Attacks, Maharashtra MLA Turns Up As Leopard To Assembly
content: The winter session of Maharashtra's legislative assembly witnessed an unusual sight on Wednesday when an MLA turned up wearing a leopard costume, complete with an artificial fur coat and a big cat mask.

title: "Women By The Age Of 25...": Case Against Spiritual Leader For Crass Remarks
content: Spiritual leader Aniruddhacharya has been accused of making derogatory remarks about women. The complaint was accepted by the Chief Judicial Magistrate (CJM) court, which has now registered the matter.

title: The Real-Life Rehman Dakait And The Pak Town That Spawned Him
content: Black Pathan suit, black blazer, and black shades -- Akshaye Khanna, playing Baloch gangster Rehman Dakait in Aditya Dhar's Dhurandhar, walks into the frame and owns every moment in a dance scene that has now gone viral

title: MMA pound-for-pound rankings: Petr Yan's upset win disrupts nearly the entire top 10
content: Petr Yan beats merab Dvalishvili at UFC 323 on saturday . the victory put him back in the pound-for-pound rankings and disrupted practically the entire men's top 10 . there was not a clear consensus among voters as to where the top fighters belong .

title: Rankings for Week 15
content:
Tristan H. Cockcroft explains what makes Joe Burrow a great quarterback option for the remainder of the fantasy season. (1:06) ESPN's weekly PPR and IDP  fantasy football  rankings are an aggregate of our rankers (eight PPR, three IDP). They are Matt Bowen, Mike Clay, Tristan H. Cockcroft, Daniel Dopp, Eric Karabell, Liz Loza, Eric Moody and Field Yates. Karabell also provides his superflex rankings all season long. Rankings will be published every Tuesday and are updated throughout the week for news and emerging analysis. PPR rankings:

title: Vindication? Liverpool earns Slot much-needed win amid Salah saga
content: a 1-0 win over inter in the UEFA champions league vs. inter takes place in milan, italy . the win was secured via a penalty, dispatched emphatically by the relentless Dominik Szoboszlai . it was a moment that perfectly encapsulated the quiet, battling brilliance of the reds' 1-0 victory over internazionale .

title: We made score picks for every postseason CFB game
content: the 12-team college football playoff is no longer new . there are more justifiably aggrieved teams at being left out . the annual coaching carousel always impacts the postseason . new coach Pete Golding will make his debut in the biggest game in team history .

title: The first 'Hail Mary': An iconic Cowboys moment and a 50-year Vikings beef
content: quarterback and wide receiver Hall of Famers were among the former players on hand . the cowboys celebrated the 50th anniversary of the most memorable play in Cowboys history . quarterback, wide receiver, hall of famers among those on hand at the time .

title: Women's Bracketology: How the Big Ten is shaping the field
content: 16 new teams entered the bracket this week and 26 more moved at least one seed line . the big Ten was the exception for a conference that is consistently putting 13 teams in the field . Michigan State was held to just 64 points in a loss at Wisconsin .

title: Previewing the NBA Cup quarterfinals
content: the 2025 Emirates NBA Cup quarterfinals kick off on tuesday . leBron James goes off for 29 points to power the lakers to a close win over the 76ers . the team will have to advance without star Franz Wagner, who left the game because of a high ankle sprain .

title: Transfer rumors, news: AC Milan make contact over move for Liverpool's Alisson
content: AC Milan are preparing to make a move to sign keeper Mohamed Salah . the 33-year-old has 18 months left on his contract at anfield . a transfer in the summer might be the opportunity of the summer .

title: Highlights, top moments as Knicks, Magic punch tickets to Vegas
content: the new york Knicks beat the Toronto Raptors 117-108 behind 37 points from guard Desmond Bane . the 49ers are tied for the most points in a season of his career . this marks the first NBA Cup semifinal appearance for the Magic .

title: Watch: Maha MLA dresses up as leopard; gives reason for unusual protest
content: Maharashtra MLA dressed as leopard The TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide. With an unwavering commitment to excellence in journalism, our team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics. The TOI News Desk is your trusted source for staying informed and connected to the ever-evolving global landscape, ensuring that our readers are equipped with the latest developments that matter most." Read More

title: Best fits for top potential pitching trade candidates
content: in 2025, 369 pitchers started a game in MLB, for an average of 12.3 per team . only 53 started at least 30 games, averaging fewer than two seasonlong starters . trades can be viewed as less risky than a trade for an established starter .

title: Negotiate with banks for reducing interest rates, Naidu tells offiicals
content: CM says lowering rates could save the State nearly ‚Çπ7,000 crore and urges departments to utilise ‚Çπ1,170 crore Central funds by December 20

title: Tourism sector attracted ‚Çπ30,000 cr. investments in 16 months: Kandula Durgesh
content: Tourism Minister says 27 hotel, resort and MICE projects approved by SIPB are progressing across the State, with 4,597 new rooms coming up and ‚Çπ428 crore secured from the Centre for developing major tourist destinations

title: Skyrocketing egg prices burn teachers‚Äô pockets to fuel midday meals in Karnataka
content: Skyrocketing prices of eggs are not just burning a hole in the pockets of regular consumers, but also teachers, who are paying from their own pockets to ensure its presence in midday meals

title: Row erupts over non-veg food sale at Gita chanting event in Kolkata
content: Political parties condemn assault as Kolkata Police probe attack on non-veg food sale at Gita event after video of¬†assault¬†goes viral

title: Police arrest leaders to prevent job aspirants‚Äô protest; action condemned
content: The incident has led to widespread criticism, with various organisations, including AIDSO, AIDYO, AIMSS, Raita Sena Karnataka, AIKKMS, AIUTUC, and others strongly condemning the incident and terming it a murder of the democratic right to protest

title: Pawan Kalyan underscores sweeping reforms in Panchayat Raj Department, vows stronger support for employees
content: Deputy CM says over 10,000 staff have been promoted since last June and 13,350 Gram Panchayats made independent units as the government pursues transparency and strengthens rural governance

title: BJP MLAs take Kya Hua Tera Wada swipe at Soren government in Jharkhand
content: Opposition MLAs allege that before coming to power, the Hemant Soren government made seven major promises to the public, including gas cylinders for ‚Çπ450, employment for 10 lakh youth every year, and timely scholarships to the poor, but the government has failed to fulfill even one of these promises

title: Satheesan challenges Pinarayi Vijayan to open debate; issues detailed rebuttal to CM‚Äôs posers
content: He responds to questions raised by the Chief Minister a day ago in an extensive statement; accuses govt. of attempting to divert attention from serious governance failures

title: Massive earthquake jolts Japan days after 7.5 tremors
content: At TOI World Desk, our dedicated team of seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sifts through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock. With an unwavering commitment to accuracy, depth, and timeliness, we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, delivering a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers. Join us on a journey across continents as we unravel the stories that shape our interconnected world. Read More

title: Assam‚Äôs Bodoland conditionally accepts ST status for six communities
content: Tai Ahom students‚Äô body decides to analyse Scheduled Tribe (Valley) category for some communities eyeing ST tag

title: The Hindu Lit for Life Dialogue 2025 returns to Hyderabad on Dec. 12 for an evening of conversation and ideas
content: The event is designed to offer a space for reflection and debate through a line-up of discussions that examine how ideas shape the world around us

title: Three powerhouses in Idukki to be shut down for repairs
content: Repairs complete on three generators at the Moolamattom power plant of the Idukki hydel power project. The Lower Periyar, Panniyar and Pallivasal powerhouses will be shut down for repair works

title: APCRDA allots 16 returnable plots to Undavalli farmers through e-lottery
content: 11 landowners secure residential and commercial plots; officials urge early registration and assure that no fee will be charged for completing the process

title: Cargo trains sought to boost horticulture exports from Tadipatri to Delhi, Mumbai
content: A dedicated rail link from Tadipatri will improve logistics, cut transit delays, and help farmers and exporters access larger markets more efficiently, says Collector

title: State is a ‚Äòcontinuum‚Äô with commitments beyond pleasing the party or leader of the day: Supreme Court
content: The apex court‚Äôs observations came while dismissing a petition filed by the State of Jharkhand against a State High Court-ordered CBI probe into an illegal mining case in which the accused are linked to CM Hemant Soren

title: IAF marks 1971 victory with spectacular flying display at Mohanbari
content: In the event, the Indian Air Force simulated attack of the famous Governor residence attack at Dhaka in the 1971 war

title: No consensus on KTU, DUK V-Cs, conciliatory meeting yields no breakthrough
content: Law Minister P. Rajeeve and Higher Education Minister R. Bindu meet Governor  Rajendra Vishwanath Arlekar at Lok Bhavan, but despite an hour-long discussion, both sides remain firm in their positions

title: Government committed to welfare of journalists, says Minister
content: ‚ÄòUnder the Journalist Welfare Scheme, the government has provided financial assistance to 402 journalists/media personnel or their families from 2014-15 to 2024-25,‚Äô Minister of State for Information and Broadcasting L. Murugan said in the Lok Sabha

title: H1B visa interviews of thousands of applicants in India cancelled triggering outrage
content: It is learnt that interviews of several other categories of visa applicants are also being postponed in view of the new norms for scrutinising the social media profiles of the applications

title: Land conversion to be simplified soon, says Revenue Minister Krishna Byre Gowda
content: With the amendment, there would be no requirement of land conversion if the plan of the construction is in tune with the master-plan

title: Thrissur all set for local body polls
content: Over 27.36 lakh voters, 7,208 candidates, and a tightly coordinated security-administration machinery gear up for polling day

title: PM Modi addressed issues of human rights violations in northeast, says Tripura CM
content: ‚ÄúNortheast had witnessed how militancy cast a shadow over human rights, but this issue has been addressed by signing peace accords under leadership of Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Union Home Minister Amit Shah," says Tripura Chief Minister

title: Watch: T.T.V. Dhinakaran warns against using Lord Murugan as a political tool in Thirupparankundram
content: AMMK general secretary T.T.V. Dhinakaran has cautioned against using Lord Murugan‚Äôs name as a political tool in Thirupparankundram, saying it creates confusion among communities living peacefully.

title: Three-phased action plan to curb child marriages in Kurnool district
content: Collector reviews implementation of 100-day national awareness campaign, which began on November 27 and will continue till March 8

title: Lokesh discusses timeline for Vizag AI data centre project with Sundar Pichai
content: The HRD Minister meets tech giants in USA and promotes Andhra Pradesh as a favourable investment destination in IT and deep-tech sectors

title: Chittoor making rapid strides in education, health, says Lanka Dinakar
content: Instructs officials to prioritise safe drinking water under the Jal Jeevan Mission and speed up AMRUT 2.0 planning, and seeks faster implementation of PM Surya Ghar

title: Two held for cheating Bengaluru man of ‚Çπ47 lakh with fake Ayurvedic treatment
content: The Jnanabharathi police have arrested two people for allegedly cheating a man of ‚Çπ47 lakh by promising ‚ÄòAyurvedic medicine‚Äô to treat his sexual issues

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

title: A.P. CM tells Ministers, officials to ensure public satisfaction in service delivery
content: All the government services will be made available online by January 15, announces the Chief Minister and asks the departments to meet the deadline
